column4: i like to play games every so often and i really hate the fact that i have to close all my work (i have like 30 windows open right now) and reboot into windows. Then when im done, i have to open it all back up. Any way for it to dump the session to the drive so i can open it later?
you have to have a big enough swap partition.
i wouldnt think that would work for my purpose. Would it? I have 8gb of ram, so a 16gb swap seemed a bit crazy
but then you can't hibernate imho
but i dont think hibernate will even work for my purpose
i think hibernate will do exactly what you want.

i am at least using two different hard drives for the two os's, so that should help a bit. I have no problem expanding my swap if its going to work the way i need it to. guess i just need to find more details on it.
swap needs to be equal or greater than ram. that is all
not sure if xfs is resizable but you can also create a file for additinonal swap space
you may need to install it first
should be an option now when shutting down. you may have to (logout, restart acpi, etc...,) easiest to just reboot
